ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Maxbytes revisited: robots.txt bytes not registered by QuotaEnforcer
ygData.msgSnippet: I think SÃ¸ren formulated the wrong question - or formulated the opposite as he really ment. The problem is that the size of the robots.txt is summed together

<html><body>


<tt>
We have encountered a new problem with the group-max-success-kb feature.<BR>
It seems that robots.txt URI is not considered by QuotaEnforcer.<BR>
These robots.txt are, however, included in the host-report.txt numbers.<BR>
<BR>
Is this planned behaviour?<BR>
<BR>
The robots.txt can be quite large: We have seen robots.txt up to 2.5<BR>
Mbytes.<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
  <BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
</tt>


  




</body></html>



--Boundary_(ID_P6612XOa2Mmxke0OhLlhjg)
